page.title: 13PLANT AND ANIMAL LIFE
page.content: The area is one of considerable natural beauty with a great deal of {deciduous woodland,}as well as a large area of{coniferous plantation. Many of the fields are extremely steep, which governs the use made of the land. A tremendous variety of{wild flowers can be found,with wild snowdrops and later the daffodils bringing many Spring sightseers. { Wild life}is also plentiful with badgers,fox,stoat,weasal as well as mice,voles,shrews and rabbits to be found. Hares are now much rarer. Buzzards,kestrel and sparrow hawk all hunt the smaller birds and mammals. Ravens are present on May Hill. There are several shooting syndicates with pheasant as the main game but partridge, woodcock and wild duck are occasionally shot.
